messages.title: Labour's Tax on Jobs will kill the recovery
messages.content: The reelection of Gordon Brown's government, with more debt, more taxes, and more waste, is a risk we cannot afford. The Conservatives will stop tax rises on jobs and support small businesses.

messages.title: Backing the NHS
messages.content: The NHS is our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone. The Conservatives will increase spending on the NHS every year.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservatives will stop tax rises on jobs, allowing savings of £150 for 45,000 businesses and up to £150 a year with the Conservative gain of 2 to 1 over working people.
The Conservatives will increase NHS spending every year to relieve the pressure it is facing as more patients live longer and we face a treatable cancer survival rate.
Conservatives will stop building on green field sites, protecting our bucolic surroundings, keeping out sprawl, and defending local voices against the central diktats.

issues.economy: Conservatives propose to save businesses £150 and workers up to £150 a year.
issues.environment: Conservatives are committed to protecting the Green Belt and oppose building on green field sites.
issues.health: Conservatives will increase NHS funding every year to deal with aging population challenges and cancer survival rates.

housing.content: Conservatives will stop the Labour government's planning to build houses between 2,500 and 4,000 homes in the BOOs area.

contactInformation.address: Sherwood Conservative Association, 19 High Street, Arnold, NG5 7DE.

images.caption: Mark Spencer with community members and interacting with constituents.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Mark Spencer has been endorsed by local farmers and residents, emphasizing his commitment to the local area and opposition to government housing plans.
